entity.social

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • entity.Identifiable
      • entity.social.Message
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Message>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringMessage

    public abstract class Message
extends Identifiable
implements java.lang.Comparable<Message>, java.io.Serializable
    Message object represents a single sentence inside a typical conversation.

    Note: This Object is designed with Immutability in mind, because message could be stored in many places (many aliases). Also Message is comparable, it compares the time.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public abstract void accept(MessageVisitor visitor)
        Visitor Design Patten, to traverse a list of Message and to properly handle each kind of Message. For example, if we want to print a list of Message. First define a MessagePrintVisitor: 
         
     class MessagePrintVisitor implements MessageVisitor{
         public void visitStringMessage(StringMessage message){
             // handle a StringMessage
             System.out.println(message.getContent());
         }
     }
        and call Message.accept in a loop: 
         
     MessageVisitor visitor = new MessagePrintVisitor();
     for(Message message : listOfMessage){
         message.accept(visitor);
     }
        Parameters:
        visitor - a MessageVisitor.
        See Also:
        MessageVisitor
